Class MainDirectory

Namespace
MdFilesMerger.Domain.Entity

MdFilesMerger.Domain.dll

Base directory for selected and ignored files.

Inheritance: BaseItem -> BaseDirectory -> MainDirectory
Implements: IComparable<T>, IDirectory, IItem, IMainDirectory 

public sealed class MainDirectory : BaseDirectory, IMainDirectory, IDirectory, IItem, IComparable<IDirectory>
Inheritance

BaseItem.Name
object.Equals(object, object)
object.GetType()
object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)
object.ToString()

Remarks

This directory will be searched for .md files. Saved paths of all selected and ignored files, associated with this instance, will be relative to this instance path ( Name).

Sets all properties to its default values.

IMainDirectory

MainDirectory(int, string?, int)

Sets Id to id, Name to adjusted path or null and MergedFileId to mergedFileId.

public MainDirectory(int id, string? path, int mergedFileId)

Parameters

id int

Identification number of item.

path string

Path to the existing directory that you want to associate with this object. It can be absolute or relative to the current directory.

mergedFileId int

Identification number of MergedFile object associated with this instance.

Remarks

If path is a valid path of existing directory, Name is set to absolute path to this directory, that uses '/' as directory separator character. Otherwise Name is set to null.

See Also

IMainDirectory

MainDirectory(int, string?, int, DateTime)

Sets Id to id, Name to path, MergedFileId to mergedFileId and ModifiedDate to modifiedDate.

public MainDirectory(int id, string? path, int mergedFileId, DateTime modifiedDate)

Parameters

id int

The item identification number.

path string

Valid absolute path to existing directory associated with this item. Path should use '/' as directory separator.

mergedFileId int

Identification number of MergedFile object associated with this instance.

modifiedDate DateTime

Date and time of last modification of this entity.

Remarks

No evaluation or adjusting is performed, so use this method only for already evaluated and prepared data, for example from database.

MainDirectory(string?)

Sets Name to adjusted path and rest properties to its default values.

public MainDirectory(string? path)

Parameters

path string

Path to the existing directory that you want to associate with this object. It can be absolute or relative to the current directory.

Remarks

If path is a valid path of existing directory, Name is set to absolute path to this directory, that uses '/' as directory separator character. Otherwise Name is set to null.
